channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.

item.title: Full-color programmable high temperature afterglow polymers based on single-molecule emitters
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 03 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-64677-4

‘High temperature afterglow materials are of interest, though designing luminescent single molecules is a challenge. Here the authors use a host-guest system achieving phosphorescence and tuneable afterglow. ‘
item.dc:title: Full-color programmable high temperature afterglow polymers based on single-molecule emitters
item.dc:creator: Zhuoran Xu
Yufeng Huang
Siyu Sun
Liangwei Ma
Bingbing Ding
He Tian
Xiang Ma

item.title: Chiral supramolecular assembly to enhance the magneto-optical rotation of organic materials
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 03 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-64663-w

The relation between magnetooptical activity and chirality has previously been confused. Chiral polymer films are presented with state-of-the-art Verdet constants, revealing the role of chirality, and a strategy to enhance the magnetooptical B term.
item.dc:title: Chiral supramolecular assembly to enhance the magneto-optical rotation of organic materials
item.dc:creator: Leo Delage-Laurin
David Reger
Abdusalom A. Suleymanov
Zachary Nelson
Louis Minion
Steven E. Kooi
Jochen R. Brandt
Giuliano Siligardi
Robert P. Cameron
Jessica Wade
Timothy M. Swager
Matthew J. Fuchter
